title: Calling `datalad metadata` triggers download of all data

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
#### What is the problem?
I thought to answer folks a question about assigning metadata to files (by recommending just to use `git annex metadata` for cases where no known extractor exists), and thought to show metadata for some files in a dataset where I know we have assigned some.  To my surprise call to `datalad metadata` instead of showing known one, started to download all (?) data files for some reason (sized to 4GB).

```shell
$> datalad install ///labs/haxby/attention              
install(notneeded): /tmp/attention (dataset) [dataset <Dataset path=/tmp/attention> was already cloned from 'http://datasets.datalad.org/labs/haxby/attention']

$> cd attention 

$> datalad metadata
[WARNING] Metadata query results might be incomplete, initial metadata aggregation was not yet performed in 1 dataset at: ['/tmp/attention'] 
Total (44 ok, 24 failed out of 231):   4%|▉                      | 191M/4.45G [00:29<10:35, 6.71MB/s]00<?, ?B/s]
sub-rid000001/func/sub-rid0 .. _task-beh_run-1_bold.nii.gz:  44%|████▍     | 16.0M/36.5M [00:16<00:18, 1.08MB/s]
sub-rid000001/func/sub-rid0 .. _task-beh_run-2_bold.nii.gz:  45%|████▌     | 16.4M/36.5M [00:16<00:17, 1.12MB/s]
sub-rid000001/func/sub-rid0 .. _task-beh_run-4_bold.nii.gz:  70%|███████   | 25.4M/36.0M [00:13<00:05, 2.08MB/s]
sub-rid000001/func/sub-rid0 .. _task-beh_run-5_bold.nii.gz:  17%|█▋        | 6.32M/36.4M [00:03<00:14, 2.04MB/s
```
I think such automagic data retrieval should not happen in such a case. I would even say that metadata should not be automagically aggregated if I merely ask for already known (if any) metadata.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

Current master, to become a 0.10, 0.9.3-1122-g3263da67
